page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Rye is a small town about three miles from the South-East coast of England. From the air it looks like an island, because it was once nearly surrounded by sea. Much of our area is very flat marshland and rough grazing and is mainly used for sheep farming. Our area also includes the village of Playden. The river Rother which flows through Rye provides a gateway for the fishermen to go to sea. As well as being very old Rye is a member of the Cinque Ports. Rye has a lot of historical interest, and is often used in films and television. In summer many tourists come to visit Rye. For anyone who wants to see what the town was like in the 18th century there is the town model. Rye also has a vast number of gift shops, antique shops, restaurants and potteries.
